boat.name: Fiddle

owners.note: Purchased by Ralf Chandler in 1952, sold in the 1970's and had several owners.
Bought by Andy Cornish and his father who sold her to Judy Brickhill and Robert Lee in about 2008. They sold her to Adam Cloote in 2014.
owners.text: Bought by Andy Cornish and his father who sold her to Judy Brickhill and Robert Lee in about

boat.full_description:
'Fiddle' was built and fished from Gravesend, shrimping and stowboating until purchased by Ralf Chandler in 1952, who took her to Whistable and dredged for oysters during the 1950s. He re-registered her on Part 1 Swansea as F127.

Chandler took her to Brixham in the late 1960s early 1970s. She was owned by several people between the 1970s and 2000 and had various work carried out which was left incomplete, leading to further deterioration.

She was purchased by Andy Cornish and his father and much work was carried out by them under the guidance of David Patient. She was then sold to Robert Lee and Hazel Brickhill in about 2008. They sailed her to Bristol where she was in the floating harbour for several years.

Adam Cloote bought 'Fiddle' in October 2014. In spring 2015 she was taken out of the water when rot was found in the original elm planking and some later Douglas fir in the bows. All this has been replaced by Mark Rolt. The restoration continues into 2015.
